title: Implement User Interaction Logging for Feedback Loop
summary: This PR introduces a logging mechanism to capture user interactions with the AI suggestions. The data collected will be used to inform the feedback loop, allowing the AI model to learn from user behavior and preferences.

review_states.comment: The code accurately logs user interactions, but it needs to include the interaction type in the logs. Additionally, please provide more details on the data privacy and security measures implemented to ensure user information is protected.
The logging mechanism is efficient, but please conduct performance tests to ensure it doesn't impact the application significantly. Looking forward to reviewing the updates.

title: Set Up GraphQL Server for CollaborateForce
summary: Initialize a GraphQL server to handle API requests for CollaborateForce, ensuring it can process queries and mutations effectively.

review_states.comment: The server setup looks good and supports basic queries and mutations. However, it needs to integrate with our existing authentication mechanisms. Please address this before proceeding.
The GraphQL setup is solid, but the authentication integration needs improvement. Consider aligning it with our current auth system.

title: Optimize WebRTC Signaling Process
summary: Implement improvements to the WebRTC signaling process to reduce latency during the initial connection setup phase. This includes optimizing the exchange of SDP (Session Description Protocol) messages and ICE (Interactive Connectivity Establishment) candidates.

review_states.comment: The code looks clean, and I appreciate the added unit tests. However, I'm concerned that the latency reduction might not consistently hit the 20% target. Please provide more detailed metrics to confirm this.
The unit tests are passing, which is great. However, I recommend adding more tests to cover edge cases, especially for network fluctuations.

title: Implement TLS Encryption for Broker Communications
summary: Introduces TLS encryption to secure data transmission between Kafka brokers.

title: End-to-End Encryption for File Sharing
summary: Adds AES-256 encryption for files shared between users to enhance data privacy.

title: Secure WebSocket Connections with AES-256
summary: Implements AES-256 encryption for WebSocket connections to protect message integrity.

title: Implement AES-256 Encryption for Data Transmission
summary: This PR introduces AES-256 encryption for all data transmitted within the CollaborateForce communication features, ensuring data confidentiality and security.

review_states.comment: The code ensures all data between clients and servers is encrypted using AES-256. Performance benchmarks show minimal impact on data transmission speed. LGTM, approved!
Unit tests cover both encryption and decryption processes thoroughly. Documentation is updated and clear. Looks good to me too, approved!

title: Implement Screen Reader Support for UI Components
summary: This PR introduces screen reader support for all UI components in the CollaborateForce dashboard. It ensures that all interactive elements are properly labeled and accessible to users relying on screen readers.

review_states.comment: Most of the ARIA labels look good, but the dropdown menus are missing some labels. Please add the necessary ARIA labels to ensure screen readers can describe their purpose accurately.
The screen reader doesn't announce the state of the toggle buttons correctly. Please ensure the toggle buttons have the correct state descriptions, indicating whether they're 'on' or 'off'.

title: Add Basic API Endpoints for CollaborateForce
summary: Implement the foundational API endpoints to allow third-party applications to access basic functionalities of CollaborateForce, such as retrieving and posting data points.

review_states.comment: The retrieval endpoints look solid and return the correct data. However, the authorization checks are missing for some endpoints. Please ensure that only authorized users can access certain data.
The retrieval part is well done, but the posting endpoints don't update the database correctly. Additionally, please add authorization checks to ensure security.

title: Revert PR# 8: Implement GraphQL Server
summary: This revert is necessary due to a change in product direction. The product team has decided to continue using REST APIs to maintain simplicity and align with our existing infrastructure. Reverting this PR will prevent unnecessary complexity and maintenance overhead associated with a GraphQL server that is no longer needed.

title: Revert PR#12: Fix Data Retrieval and Posting Bugs
summary: This revert is necessary to address critical bugs introduced by PR#12, which affect data retrieval and posting functionalities. Some endpoints are not returning the expected data, and there are errors when trying to post new data. Reverting this PR will restore the application's functionality while we investigate and fix the underlying issues.

title: Enhance WebRTC Data Channel Performance

The reliability improvements are evident, but the latency reduction isn't consistent in the benchmarks. Consider adjusting the test scenarios or further tweaking the congestion control settings.

The implementation seems robust, but the performance tests show higher latency than expected during the handshake process. Consider optimizing that part and ensure the documentation highlights the security benefits of the handshake process.

The examples are well done, but the integration guidelines need more detail, particularly on error handling. Looking forward to the updated version.

title: Add REST API Documentation
summary: Provides detailed documentation for the REST API, including endpoint descriptions, request/response examples, and authentication guidelines.

title: Enhance CRD Documentation
summary: Improves the documentation for Custom Resource Definitions (CRDs), offering examples and best practices for defining and using CRDs.

title: Add Hooks API Guide
summary: Introduces a comprehensive guide for using the Hooks API, including common patterns, examples, and integration tips.

title: Add Documentation for GraphQL API Usage

review_states.comment: The documentation is comprehensive and covers all aspects of the GraphQL API. The usage examples are clear and easy to follow. Great job!

title: Query Performance Degradation
summary: During peak load, complex queries experience significant slowdowns, affecting data retrieval times.

title: Intermittent API Server Authentication Failures
summary: API server occasionally fails to authenticate requests, causing disruptions in cluster management operations.

title: JWT Signature Verification Inconsistencies
summary: Some JWT tokens fail signature verification, leading to authentication errors for users.

title: Update Cryptographic Library to Fix JWT Signature Verification Error
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the JWT Signature Verification Error encountered by external applications when authenticating using JSON Web Tokens (JWT). The root cause was identified as an outdated cryptographic library in the CollaborateForce API.

### Changes Made
- Updated the cryptographic library to the latest version to ensure compatibility with JWT signatures generated by external applications.
- Refactored the JWT verification logic to align with the updated library's API.

### Testing
- Verified that JWTs generated by external applications are now correctly verified by the CollaborateForce API.
- Conducted regression testing to ensure no other parts of the application were affected by the library update.
- All unit and integration tests passed successfully.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The updated cryptographic library resolves the JWT signature verification issue effectively, and all tests have passed. Approved for merge.

title: Model Training Feedback Loop Failure
summary: The model training process does not incorporate user feedback, leading to repeated errors in model predictions.

title: Inaccurate Dashboard Recommendations
summary: Suggested dashboards do not match the context of the data source, causing confusion for users.

title: RBAC Permission Leak
summary: Misconfigured role-based access control allows unauthorized users to access restricted resources.

title: Optimize Database Query to Resolve Data Fetch Bottleneck
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the data fetch bottleneck issue that was causing slow response times during peak usage periods. The root cause was identified as inefficient query optimization in the backend server.

### Changes Made
- Refactored the database query logic to improve efficiency and reduce latency when retrieving large datasets.
- Implemented indexing on frequently queried columns to enhance query performance.
- Added caching mechanisms to store frequently accessed data temporarily, reducing the need for repeated database queries.

### Testing
- Conducted load testing to simulate peak usage scenarios and verified that the response times for data fetching have significantly improved.
- Performed regression testing to ensure that the changes do not negatively impact other parts of the system.
- Verified that visualizations update promptly and accurately with the optimized query logic.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The query optimization effectively resolves the bottleneck issue, and the testing results confirm improved performance. Approved for merge.

title: Rate Limiting Misconfiguration
summary: Developers encounter unexpected rate limiting when using Django's REST framework, hindering API integration.

title: Delayed State Update Propagation
summary: State changes in React components are not reflected immediately in the UI, causing user confusion.

title: Session Token Expiry Issue
summary: Session tokens are not invalidated upon logout, posing a security risk for applications using OAuth2 Proxy.

title: Fix OAuth Token Validation Misconfiguration in API Authentication
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of intermittent authentication failures with the CollaborateForce API due to a misconfiguration in the OAuth token validation process.

### Changes Made
- Corrected the OAuth token validation logic to ensure valid tokens are properly recognized and accepted.
- Updated configuration settings to align with the expected token validation parameters.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify the correct handling of valid and invalid tokens.
- Performed integration tests with external applications to ensure consistent and successful authentication.
- Monitored API logs to confirm the absence of authentication errors post-fix.

review_states.comment: The fix for the OAuth token validation issue looks solid. I've reviewed the changes and tested the scenarios, and everything is working as expected. Great job on resolving this quickly!

title: Incorrect Data Visualization Mapping
summary: Data points are incorrectly mapped in dashboards, leading to potential misinterpretation of metrics.

title: Unauthorized Access to Admin Features
summary: Security flaw allows unauthorized users to access admin features, posing a significant security risk.

title: Inconsistent API Key Validation
summary: API gateway sporadically denies valid API keys, causing disruptions in service access for external applications.

title: Data Synchronization Error
summary: Users see outdated files due to occasional sync issues between the server and client apps.

title: Dashboard Rendering Delay
summary: Users experience delays in dashboard rendering when multiple queries are processed simultaneously.

title: Incorrect Code Completion Suggestions
summary: The code suggestion engine provides irrelevant or outdated completions, confusing users during coding.

title: Fix Misalignment Between NLP Module and Visualization Recommendation Algorithm
summary:
### Summary
This Pull Request addresses the issue of inconsistent visualization recommendations provided by the AI Suggestion Engine. The problem was identified as a misalignment between the NLP module and the visualization recommendation algorithm, leading to contextually inappropriate suggestions.

### Changes Made
- Updated the NLP module to better interpret the context of discussions.
- Refined the visualization recommendation algorithm to ensure alignment with the NLP module outputs.
- Added additional unit tests to verify the contextual accuracy of the recommendations.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to ensure the NLP module correctly interprets discussion context.
- Performed integration tests to validate that the visualization recommendations align with the context.
- Manually tested various discussion scenarios to confirm the reliability of the suggestions.

review_states.comment: Looks great! The changes effectively address the issue of misalignment, and the testing confirms improved reliability of the visualization recommendations. Approved.

title: Fix Feedback Loop in AI Suggestion Engine to Adapt to User Feedback
summary:
### Summary
This Pull Request addresses the issue where the AI Suggestion Engine failed to adapt to user feedback, resulting in repeated suggestions of previously rejected data points.

### Changes Made
- Corrected the bug in the reinforcement learning component that was preventing the feedback loop from functioning properly.
- Updated the algorithm to ensure that user interactions are effectively incorporated into the recommendation strategy.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify that the feedback loop now correctly updates the suggestion engine.
- Performed integration tests to ensure that the system adapts to user feedback as expected, reducing the occurrence of repeated suggestions.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The fix effectively addresses the issue with the feedback loop, and the testing confirms that the AI Suggestion Engine now adapts to user feedback as intended. Approved for merge.

title: Fix Token Expiry Mismanagement by Promptly Updating Revocation List
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of session tokens not being properly invalidated after logout, which allowed unauthorized users to reuse them to access collaborative features.

### Changes Made
- Updated the security module to ensure the token revocation list is updated immediately upon user logout.
- Added a mechanism to check the revocation list before granting access to collaborative features.
- Refactored the token management logic to improve efficiency and reliability.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify that tokens are invalidated correctly upon logout.
- Performed integration tests to ensure that the revocation list is updated in real-time and that stale tokens are rejected.
- Manually tested the logout process to confirm that no unauthorized access is possible with expired tokens.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The fix effectively addresses the token expiry issue, and the testing strategy ensures robustness. Approved for merge.

title: Weak Encryption Algorithm Default
summary: Sensitive data is encrypted using a deprecated algorithm, posing a security risk for users relying on default settings.

title: Dashboard Rendering Delay
summary: Users experience significant delays when loading complex dashboards due to inefficient rendering queue management.

title: Stale Data in Cache
summary: Clients receive outdated data due to improper cache invalidation, affecting real-time data accuracy.

title: Fix Rate Limiting Misalignment by Correcting Client IP Detection
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of unexpected rate limiting faced by external applications due to a misalignment in the rate limiting configuration and incorrect client IP address detection.

### Changes Made
- Updated the IP detection logic to accurately capture the client's IP address, ensuring that rate limiting is applied correctly based on actual usage patterns.
- Adjusted the rate limiting configuration in CollaborateForce to align with the updated IP detection logic.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify the accuracy of the new IP detection logic.
- Performed integration tests to ensure that the rate limiting now aligns with expected API usage patterns.
- Monitored API requests from external applications to confirm that the rate limiting is functioning as intended without denying valid requests.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The fix effectively addresses the root cause of the rate limiting issue, and the testing confirms that the solution works as expected. Approved.

title: Optimize Message Queue to Reduce Data Propagation Delay
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of delayed data propagation from the database to the user interface, which was causing users to work with outdated data during collaborative sessions.

### Changes Made
- Optimized the message queue processing logic to handle a higher volume of updates efficiently.
- Implemented asynchronous processing to reduce bottlenecks in the data pipeline.
- Added logging to monitor queue performance and identify potential future bottlenecks.

### Testing
- Conducted load testing to ensure the message queue can handle peak loads without delays.
- Verified that updates are reflected in the user interface in near real-time during collaborative sessions.
- Monitored system performance to ensure no new bottlenecks were introduced.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The optimization effectively reduces the delay in data propagation, and the testing confirms that the issue is resolved. Approved for merge.

title: Fix Unauthorized Access Vulnerability by Implementing Proper Access Control Checks
summary:
### Summary of the Issue
A security vulnerability was identified that allowed unauthorized users to access certain collaborative features without proper permissions. This was due to improper access control checks in the security module, leading to potential privilege escalation.

### Changes Made
- Implemented comprehensive access control checks in the security module to ensure that only authorized users can access collaborative features.
- Refactored the existing code to enhance security and maintainability.
- Added unit and integration tests to verify that access control checks are functioning as expected.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to ensure that the new access control checks are correctly implemented.
- Performed integration tests to validate that the collaborative features are only accessible to users with the appropriate permissions.
- Conducted manual testing to verify that the fix resolves the vulnerability without introducing new issues.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The implementation of access control checks is thorough, and the testing strategy ensures that the vulnerability is effectively addressed. Approved for merge.

title: Cache Invalidation Failure
summary: Stale data is served due to improper cache invalidation, leading to outdated information being displayed to users.

title: Unsecured API Endpoints
summary: Certain API endpoints are exposed without proper authentication, risking unauthorized access to sensitive data.

title: Bias in Model Predictions
summary: The model exhibits bias towards specific data inputs, resulting in skewed predictions and unfair outcomes.

title: Token Expiry Mismatch
summary: OAuth tokens expire prematurely, causing authentication failures for users accessing protected resources.

title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
summary: Malicious scripts can be injected into comment sections, potentially exposing user data to attackers.

title: Delayed Model Update Propagation
summary: Recent data changes are not reflected in model predictions, leading to outdated AI recommendations.

title: Fix Race Condition in API Key Validation Logic
summary:
This pull request addresses the issue of inconsistent API key validation due to a race condition in the validation logic. The root cause was identified as concurrent requests leading to sporadic access denials. 

To resolve this, the validation logic has been refactored to ensure thread safety and consistent outcomes across concurrent requests. Specifically, synchronization mechanisms have been implemented to manage concurrent access to shared resources during the validation process.

The fix was tested by simulating concurrent API requests in a controlled environment to ensure consistent validation results. Additionally, unit tests have been updated and expanded to cover edge cases related to concurrent access.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The refactoring effectively addresses the race condition, and the testing strategy ensures robustness. Approved for merge.

title: Fix Race Condition in Database Update Mechanism for Real-Time Synchronization
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the data synchronization error between the CollaborateForce database and the user interface, which was caused by a race condition in the database update mechanism.

### Changes Made
- Implemented a locking mechanism to ensure atomic updates to the database, preventing race conditions.
- Refactored the update logic to improve real-time data propagation.
- Added unit tests to cover various scenarios of data updates and synchronization.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify that the locking mechanism prevents race conditions.
- Performed integration tests to ensure real-time synchronization between the database and the user interface.
- Manually tested the application to confirm that the issue is resolved and no outdated information is displayed.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The implementation effectively resolves the race condition, and the added tests provide good coverage. Approved for merge.

title: Partial Component Rendering
summary: Components intermittently fail to render fully, leading to incomplete UI displays for users.

title: Concurrent Request Handling Bottleneck
summary: High concurrency causes delays in processing HTTP requests, affecting server response times.

title: Scope Misconfiguration in OAuth2 Proxy
summary: Incorrect scope settings prevent external applications from accessing required resources.

title: Update Security Module to Use Modern Encryption Algorithm
summary:
This pull request addresses the issue of improper data encryption in collaborative discussions. The root cause was identified as the use of an outdated encryption algorithm in the security module, which was vulnerable to known exploits. 

To resolve this, the encryption algorithm has been updated to a modern, secure standard that ensures data is properly encrypted in transit. The changes include:
- Replacing the outdated algorithm with AES-256 encryption.
- Updating relevant documentation to reflect the changes.

The fix was tested by:
- Conducting unit tests to verify the encryption and decryption processes.
- Performing integration tests to ensure data is securely transmitted and received in collaborative discussions.
- Running security audits to confirm the elimination of vulnerabilities.

These changes ensure that sensitive data is now securely encrypted, protecting it from unauthorized access.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The update to AES-256 encryption effectively addresses the vulnerability. I've reviewed the code and tested the implementation, and everything is functioning as expected. Approved for merge.

title: Excessive Kernel Suggestions
summary: The kernel suggestion engine floods users with too many code completion options, slowing down the notebook interface.

title: Merge Conflict Display Error
summary: Merge conflicts in repositories are not accurately reflected in the UI, leading to potential data inconsistencies.

title: Misleading Model Predictions
summary: The model inference engine occasionally provides contextually irrelevant predictions, affecting user trust in AI outputs.

title: Fix Cache Invalidation Logic to Ensure UI Displays Updated Data
summary:
This pull request addresses the issue of stale data being displayed in the CollaborateForce UI due to improper cache invalidation. The root cause was identified as a failure in the cache invalidation logic, which did not trigger upon database updates. 

To resolve this, the cache invalidation mechanism has been updated to correctly listen for and respond to database changes, ensuring that the UI always serves the most recent data. 

The fix was tested by simulating database updates and verifying that the UI reflects these changes immediately, confirming that the cache is invalidated and refreshed as expected.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The fix effectively addresses the cache invalidation issue, and the testing confirms that the UI now displays updated data as intended. Approved for merge.

title: Fix Bias in Recommendation Algorithm by Balancing Training Dataset
summary:
### Summary of the Issue
The AI Suggestion Engine was exhibiting a bias towards certain data sources, resulting in skewed recommendations. This was traced back to an imbalanced training dataset that over-represented specific data sources.

### Changes Made
- Rebalanced the training dataset to ensure a more even representation of all data sources.
- Updated the data preprocessing pipeline to include checks for data source distribution.
- Enhanced the recommendation algorithm to dynamically adjust for any detected imbalances in real-time.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify that the dataset rebalancing logic works as intended.
- Performed integration tests to ensure the recommendation engine now provides a more balanced output.
- Ran A/B tests comparing the previous and updated recommendation outputs to confirm the bias has been mitigated.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The rebalancing of the dataset and the updates to the algorithm effectively address the bias issue. All tests pass, and the recommendations are now more balanced. Approved for merge.

title: Fix Cache Invalidation Logic to Prevent Stale Data
summary:
### Summary
This Pull Request addresses the cache invalidation issue where users were served stale data, causing delays in updating visualizations.

### Changes Made
- Refactored the cache invalidation logic on the backend server to ensure that data is correctly invalidated and refreshed.
- Added unit tests to verify the new cache invalidation behavior.
- Updated integration tests to cover scenarios involving data updates and cache refreshes.

### Testing
- Ran unit tests to confirm that the cache invalidation logic works as expected.
- Conducted integration tests to ensure that visualizations are updated promptly with current data.
- Verified that no stale data is served to users under various data update scenarios.

review_states.comment: Looks great! The refactored cache invalidation logic is clear and the tests provide good coverage. Thanks for addressing this issue promptly. Approved!

title: Fix Token Expiry Mismatch by Correcting Time Zone Handling
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of unexpected token expiry experienced by external applications due to incorrect time zone handling in the CollaborateForce API.

### Changes Made
- Updated the token generation logic to ensure consistent time zone handling across the API and external applications.
- Adjusted the expiry time calculation to use UTC consistently, eliminating discrepancies.

### Testing
- Verified the token expiry time is consistent with the expected duration across different time zones.
- Conducted integration tests with external applications to confirm successful authentication without premature expiry.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The fix effectively resolves the token expiry mismatch issue, and the testing confirms the solution works as intended. Approved for merge.

title: Fix XSS Vulnerability in CollaborateForce by Sanitizing User Inputs
summary:
### Summary of the Issue
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability was identified in the CollaborateForce feature, where user inputs were not properly sanitized, allowing attackers to inject malicious scripts. This posed a risk of exposing sensitive data during collaborative discussions.

### Changes Made
- Implemented input sanitization in the security module to ensure all user inputs in the CollaborateForce feature are properly escaped and validated.
- Added utility functions to handle input sanitization consistently across the application.
- Updated existing tests and added new test cases to cover various input scenarios and ensure the sanitization process is robust.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify that the input sanitization functions correctly handle a variety of input types, including edge cases.
- Performed integration testing within the CollaborateForce feature to ensure no XSS vulnerabilities remain and that the feature functions as expected.
- Conducted manual testing by simulating potential attack vectors to confirm the fix effectively mitigates the vulnerability.

review_states.comment: Great work on addressing the XSS vulnerability! The input sanitization is thorough, and the additional test coverage provides confidence in the fix. Approved for merge.

title: Optimize Session Management for High Concurrency
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of delayed updates in the visualization module when multiple users join a session concurrently. The root cause was identified as inefficiencies in the backend server's session management system under high concurrency.

### Changes Made
- Refactored the session management logic to improve handling of concurrent requests.
- Implemented asynchronous processing for session updates to reduce bottlenecks.
- Enhanced the server's resource allocation strategy to better manage high loads.

### Testing
- Conducted stress tests simulating high concurrency scenarios to ensure the system handles multiple users efficiently.
- Verified that updates in the visualization module are processed without delays during collaborative sessions.
- Performed regression testing to confirm no adverse effects on existing functionalities.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The refactoring and optimizations have significantly improved the system's ability to handle concurrent sessions. I have reviewed the code and tested the functionality, and everything is working as expected. Approved for merge.

title: Fix Timeout Issue to Ensure Complete Data Load
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue where the user interface occasionally loads only partial data sets due to a timeout in the data retrieval process.

### Changes Made
- Increased the timeout duration for the data retrieval process to ensure complete data sets are fetched from the database.
- Implemented a retry mechanism to handle transient network issues that may cause timeouts.
- Added logging to capture timeout events for future analysis and monitoring.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify that the timeout and retry mechanisms work as expected.
- Performed integration testing to ensure that complete data sets are consistently loaded in the user interface.
- Monitored the application in a staging environment to confirm that the issue is resolved and no partial data loads occur.

review_states.comment: Looks great! The fix effectively addresses the timeout issue, and the additional logging will be helpful for monitoring. All tests pass, and the solution has been verified in staging. Approved for merge.

title: Fix OAuth Scope Misconfiguration for External Applications
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of OAuth scope misconfiguration that prevented external applications from accessing necessary resources. The root cause was identified as incorrect scope assignments during authentication.

### Changes Made
- Updated the OAuth scope mapping configuration to ensure that all required scopes are correctly assigned to the relevant API endpoints.
- Refactored the authentication module to improve scope validation logic.

### Testing
- Verified that external applications can now successfully authenticate and access the required resources with the correct scopes.
- Conducted unit tests to ensure that the scope mapping changes do not affect existing functionality.
- Performed integration tests with external applications to confirm end-to-end functionality.

This fix ensures that external applications can access the necessary resources without any scope-related issues.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The fix effectively resolves the OAuth scope misconfiguration issue, and the testing confirms that the solution works as expected. Approved for merge.
